summary: Email correspondence between Assistant U.S. Attorney Maurene Comey and defense attorney Jeff Pagliuca regarding the scheduling of a call and the service of a grand jury subpoena to Ghislaine Maxwell. The email references the sealed indictment against Jeffrey Epstein, which is anticipated to be unsealed the following day.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Attorney authorized to accept service of a grand jury subpoena for Ghislaine Maxwell. He coordinates scheduling with prosecutors and seeks a copy of the Epstein indictment.

persons.name: Nicole Simmons
persons.context: Copied on the email correspondence, appears to be a colleague of Jeff Pagliuca at the law firm Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The recipient of a grand jury subpoena for testimony issued by the Southern District of New York. Her attorney is coordinating her response.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced as 'Mr. Epstein,' whose indictment is currently under seal but anticipated to be unsealed and publicly available. His presentment timing affects the prosecutors' schedule.

connections.description: Pagliuca is authorized to accept service of a grand jury subpoena on behalf of Maxwell, indicating he is acting as her legal counsel.
Simmons is copied on the email and is a colleague at the same law firm, Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C.
Maxwell is being subpoenaed in relation to the investigation into Epstein, as indicated by the context of the correspondence about his indictment.

events.title: Anticipated Unsealing of Epstein Indictment
events.description: The indictment against Jeffrey Epstein is currently under seal but is anticipated to be unsealed and made publicly available.

events.title: Presentment of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: The timing of Epstein's court presentment is uncertain and affects the prosecutors' schedule for coordinating a call with Maxwell's attorney.

events.title: Service of Subpoena to Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: A grand jury subpoena for testimony is issued to Ghislaine Maxwell by the Southern District of New York, with service accepted by her attorney Jeff Pagliuca.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: A grand jury subpoena for testimony was issued to Ghislaine Maxwell by the Southern District of New York on or before July 7, 2019.
Jeffrey Epstein's indictment was under seal as of July 7, 2019, with prosecutors anticipating it would be unsealed and made public on July 8, 2019.
Defense attorney Jeff Pagliuca was authorized to accept service of the subpoena on Maxwell's behalf and was coordinating a response, potentially involving a proffer or testimony.
The timing of Epstein's court presentment was affecting the prosecutors' schedule for coordinating with Maxwell's legal team.
The email correspondence shows active coordination between Maxwell's defense and federal prosecutors in the early stages of the publicly known investigation.
